p: Surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) is a fast and very sensitive analytical method and is used to detect or quantify trace amounts of pesticides in raw vegetables and fruits [ 43]. Fan et al. [ 44] showed that the feasibility of applying SERS for detection must be at least 1 mg/g for phosmet and 0.5 mg/g for carbaryl in apples. Luo et al. [ 45] analysed thiabendazole and phosmet, which has a broad range of applications in the analysis of other trace amounts of chemicals contaminants in food.
